content:
• Thursday, September 11, 2014
  • XPO

    XPO Logistics gets $700M investment to fund acquisitions

    • XPO Logistics (NYSEMKT:XPO) +3.4% AH on news it has secured a $700M investment from the Ontario Teachers' Pension Plan, Canada's Public Sector Pension Investment Board and Singapore's GIC Private Ltd., which will be used to fund acquisitions.
    • The investment will be structured in the form of common stock and preferred stock, giving the three funds a roughly 21% combined stake in XPO; Jacobs Private Equity, CEO Bradley Jacobs' investment vehicle, would be left with a ~24% stake.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:06 PM

  • After Hour Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: CNVR +32.6%. ULTA +13.1%. SPWH +7.6%. CRTO +6.0%. HTZ +4.5%.
    • Top losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: BSMX -7.0%. GFI -2.5%. GIS -2.0%. KOS -1.5%. MPEL -1.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM
  • HTZ

    Hertz agrees to add three Icahn-approved directors

    • Hertz (NYSE:HTZ) +3.9% AH after saying it reached an agreement-in-principle with Carl Icahn to install three new directors to replace three existing directors who will retire.
    • Icahn agrees not to run a proxy contest at its annual shareholder meeting in exchange for the directors, two of whom will be part a search committee to find a new CEO.
    • Icahn last month disclosed an 8.5% stake in the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM | 1 Comment
  • HBNK

    Hampden Bancorp completes buyback, starts another

    • Hampden's (NASDAQ:HBNK) 7th stock repurchase program started about two years ago and was completed yesterday, with 289K or roughly 5% of the float bought back at an average price of $15.74 each.
    • The company's eight program - launched today - is for another 275.5K shares, or roughly 5% of today's current float.
    • The stock's higher by 1.4% after-hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • FUEL

    Rocket Fuel soars on Alliance Data/Conversant deal

    • On the move amid the Conversant sale to Alliance Data Systems is Rocket Fuel (NASDAQ:FUEL) which shot 12% higher at the close of the regular session and has gained another 3.4% in after-hours action.
    • Previously: Alliance Data buying Conversant in $2.3B deal
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM | 7 Comments
  • TITN

    Titan Machinery CEO discloses ~90K-share purchase

    • Titan Machinery (TITN +4.9%) popped more than 5% around noon and held most of its gains, as CEO David Meyer disclosed a purchase of 90,250 shares at $13 each worth ~$1,174M; the transaction occurred yesterday.
    • Meyer now owns more than 750K TITN shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • WELL

    Health Care REIT with secondary; details acquisition pipeline

    • Health Care REIT (HCN) is offering 15.5M shares with an underwriter greenshoe of another 2.35M shares.
    • As for what it might do with that money, the company - based on closings thus far this quarter and signed letters of intent - anticipates acquiring about $1.7B of properties in H2. This includes the already-announced $950M HealthLease Properties deal, and the $257M Gracewell purchase.
    • Shares -3.2% AH
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 5 Comments
  • ULTA

    Strong e-commerce growth boosts Ulta Salon

    • Ulta Salon (NASDAQ:ULTA) reports comparable-store sales rose 9.6% in Q2.
    • E-commerce comp sales +54.9%.
    • Average ticket price +3.8%.
    • Transaction volume growth +5.8%.
    • Gross profit rate flat at 35.3%.
    • Guidance: Comp sales growth of 7%-8% is expected for FY14. Total sales are expected to rise 20%.
    • ULTA +8.8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • CNVR

    Alliance Data buying Conversant in $2.3B deal

    • It's a cash and stock deal valued at about $2.3B or $35 per Conversant (NASDAQ:CNVR) share (vs. today's $26.71 close), and represents 10x Conversant's expected 2015 adjusted EBITDA. Consideration will be 52% Alliance Data Systems (NYSE:ADS) stock and 48% ($16.80) cash.
    • ADS expects "substantial accretion" from the deal - about $0.50-$0.75 in core EPS in years one and two ... this without any expected revenue or cost synergies.
    • Alliance CEO Ed Heffernan: "The acquisition 'bulks up' Alliance Data in digital marketing, which is experiencing the fastest secular growth."
    • A conference call is set for 5:30 ET.
    • Both stocks remain halted.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • ULTA

    Ulta Salon beats by $0.11, beats on revenue

    • Ulta Salon (NASDAQ:ULTA): Q2 EPS of $0.94 beats by $0.11.
    • Revenue of $734.23M (+22.2% Y/Y) beats by $21.22M.
    • Shares +9.43% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • GNTLF

    Genetic Tech requests trading halt

    • Australia-based Genetic Technologies (OTC:GNTLF) requests a suspension of trading in its shares on the Australian Exchange (ASX:GTG) pending its announcement concerning the finalization of a proposed financing. It requests the suspension to remain in place until the announcement is made or normal exchange trading resumes on Monday, September 15, 2014.
    • In conjunction with its request, NASDAQ halted trading in the company's ADS at 4:01 pm on September 9.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM | 1 Comment
  • PEIX

    U.S. ethanol producers plunge on worries over Brazilian imports

    • Pacific Ethanol (PEIX -7%) and other U.S. ethanol producers are sharply lower, apparently on fears that the industry in America could be hit by a surge of Brazilian imports.
    • Brazil yesterday approved a tax credit for domestic ethanol exporters, which the government believes will help its domestic exporters "because it cheapens the Brazilian export and pays a devaluation of the exchange rate," the country's finance minister says.
    • Ethanol demand has fallen in Brazil in recent years, with only 25% of flex-fuel cars there using ethanol in 2013 vs. 82% in 2009, according to Bloomberg.
    • U.S. ethanol makers already have been pressured by the EPA's proposals to cut the amount of biofuels that refiners will be required to blend into gasoline, and moves by California regulators that have given Brazilian sugar ethanol a better greenhouse gas rating than corn-based ethanol produced in the U.S.
    • Also: GPRE -4.4%, REX -6.7%, KIOR -8.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM | 6 Comments
  • HP

    Helmerich & Payne +2% as Argus upgrades to Buy

    • Helmerich & Payne (HP -1.9%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $124 price target at Argus, which believes HP's rare underperformance relative to the market over the last three months provides a favorable entry point for investors seeking exposure to a top U.S. drilling company with a focus on unconventional resources.
    • Argus says HP continues to benefit from its position as the leading provider of high-horsepower, high-specification, premium AC-drive rigs in the U.S. onshore market, which are favored by E&P customers drilling complex unconventional horizontal wells.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • MEP

    Midcoast Energy -5.5% after BofA downgrade

    • Midcoast Energy Partners (MEP -5.5%) is downgraded to Underperform from Neutral with a $21 price target at BofA/Merrill, which believes certain risks are not reflected in MEP's 5.2% distribution rate.
    • The firm sees continued downside risk to MEP's marketing and logistics segment due to reduced commodity price volatility, execution risk with drop-downs from Enbridge Energy Partners, and high leverage at the Midcoast Operating level.
    • MEP's geographic concentration and exposure to second-tier production basins also is a risk, as low commodity prices have persisted, BofA says.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • EFOI

    Energy Focus +40% after winning $7.7M U.S. Navy order

    • Energy Focus (EFOI +40%) is sharply higher after receiving the largest single order in the company's history, a $7.7M order for U.S. Navy combatant ship forces.
    • EFOI says the order is for its energy efficient LED retrofit tubes, which are now employed and installed in more than 140 naval vessels in the U.S. Navy military fleet, up from fewer than 20 in the beginning of 2014.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM
  • WB

    Weibo flies after positive coverage

    • Initiating Weibo (WB +13.1%) with a Buy and $24 price target, T.H. Capital's Tian Hou says the slowdown in the company's user growth may be coming to an end. Why? Tencent's more popular WeChat - having penetrated about the entire Internet population in China - is plateauing.
    • "We believe there has been an increase in users and user engagement levels (for Weibo)," says Tian. "User growth can be seen from the rapid Weibo mobile download growth, which reached 1.6 billion download times by August 12, 2014, or growth of 84% from the beginning of the year."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • VIRC

    Virco Manufacturing reports FQ2 profit

    • Virco Manufacturing Corporation (NASDAQ:VIRC): FQ2 EPS of $0.35.
    • Revenue of $53.2M (-6.6% Y/Y).
    • Shares +9.52%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Top 10 Gainers: EFOI +38%. SCOK +28%. MSON +22%. GTIM +17%. NEPT +15%. LULU +15%. NES +13%. IMDZ +10%. JDSU +12%. SSY +11%.
    • Top 10 Losers: EOPN -30%. NETE -24%. INVE -19%. SYMX -19%. VNET -17%. IHT -12%. PEIX -11%. MTSL -11%. INPH -10%. BRC -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • SDRL

    Seadrill-North American Drilling deal with Rosneft still at risk from sanctions

    • Seadrill (SDRL -2.1%) CFO Rune Lundetrae says sanctions against Russia may still affect the $4.25B deal between SDRL, North American Drilling (NADL -5.5%) and Rosneft (OTCPK:RNFTF).
    • NADL and Rosneft rushed to sign five-year contracts for six offshore rigs at the end of July, just days before the EU broadened sanctions against Russia to target its energy sector directly; SDRL, which owns 70% of NADL, said at the time the contracts appeared not to be affected by the restrictions.
    • “It’s not necessarily looking brighter,” Lundetrae says, but notes that some of the contracts start as late as 2017 and none earlier than 2015, which reduces the risk for NADL and SDRL.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM | 23 Comments
  • CPG

    Crescent Point failing to attract U.S. investors despite fat dividend

    • Crescent Point Energy (CPG -2%) is trying to reverse declining U.S. ownership of its shares as investors chase soaring output growth by U.S. shale producers; American investment in the company has dropped to 24% from 43% two years ago.
    • While CPG's dividend yield is almost double the average for North American peers, the company also isn’t getting as much credit in Canada for its returns as others emulating its model, according to CEO Scott Saxberg.
    • Saxberg says his challenge is to explain why CPG provides a dividend instead of reinvesting all its cash into producing more oil, but analysts say CPG may struggle to win over U.S. investors unless it boosts production and dividends while paying for acquisitions out of cash flow rather than equity.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM | 25 Comments
  • S

    Sprint on the move as Claure addresses conference

    • "We're implementing a culture of must-have and nice-to-have," new Sprint (S +5%) CEO Marcello Claure tells the audience (webcast) at the Goldman Communacopia Conference. "We have to focus on must-have and nice-to-have will have to go."
    • Everything is on the table, he says, and "some [managers] will make it and some won't."
    • The advice he got upon becoming CEO of a public company for the first time was not to change anything for the first 100 days, "but I just couldn't help myself," and Sprint overhauled its offerings on day 4.
    • Previously: Claure: Sprint to slash prices, cut more jobs
     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM | 5 Comments
  • VNET

    21Vianet extends slide after refuting fraud allegations

    • 21Vianet (VNET -16.8%) continues to plunge after rejecting allegations of fraud from a short seller during a conference call with investors; shares have dropped nearly 40% this week.
    • In the call, VNET answered questions on issues raised by Trinity Research about accounts receivable and managed network services, but Rosenblatt Securities analyst Jun Zhang says “the management didn’t sound well prepared for the conference call, and the managers who answered the questions seemed not very familiar with its business details."
    • Canaccord analyst Greg Miller earlier defended VNET, maintaining a Buy rating with a $35 price target and saying the financial analysis in the fraud report was of "extremely poor quality."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • IP

    International Paper rallies amid MLP chatter

    • Presenting at the UBS Global Paper and Forest Products Conference this morning, International Paper (IP +2.5%) management says it's moved from a study phase on possible conversion to an MLP structure to a "more serious evaluation phase."
    • At the same conference, KapStone (KS +2%) says it's taking a look at the MLP idea as well.
    • Others in the industry also have their tails in the air: Rock-Tenn (RKT +2.2%), Packaging Corp. (PKG +1.3%), MeadWestvaco (MWV +1.9%).
    • International Paper Tuesday night boosted its quarterly payout by 14% to $0.40 per share. The dividend is payable on Dec. 15 to holders of record on Nov. 17. The annualized yield is 3.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM
  • HTS

    Hatteras gains as it maintains payout, gets upgrade

    • Investors may have been on edge after CYS Investments unexpectedly cut its dividend earlier in the week, but Hatteras (HTS +1.5%) maintains its $0.50 quarterly payout.
    • Even after the gain today, the stock price of $19.82 remains at a hefty discount (10.8%) to June 30 book value of $22.23.
    • Compass Point upgrades Hatteras to a Buy from Hold.
    • Previously: Hatteras Financial declares $0.50 dividend
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • TAM

    Taminco to be acquired by Eastman Chemical for $2.8B

    • Taminco (TAM +11.8%) says it has agreed to be acquired by Eastman Chemical (EMN +0.1%) for $26/share.
    • The merger agreement includes a 30-day go-shop period, when TAM will solicit and evaluate any alternative proposals.
    • EMN says the acquisition strengthens its presence in attractive niche markets such as food, feed and agriculture, and adds a world-class technology platform in alkylamines to its portfolio.
    • EMN expects the deal to be accretive to 2015 EPS by greater than $0.35, excluding acquisition-related costs and charges, and to 2016 EPS by greater than $0.60.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM | 1 Comment
  • MVC

    MVC Capital lower by 2% after earnings fall

    • FQ3 interest income of $3.2M, dividend income of $811K, and fee and other income of $1M vs. $2.6M, $3M, and $1.6M, respectively one year ago. The big drop in dividend income comes as U.S. Gas & Electric did not make a payout in FQ3.
    • Net decrease in net assets resulting from operations of $0.35 per share compared to a gain of $0.79 one year ago. Net asset value per share of $15.86 falls from $16.42 at end of FQ2 and $17.36 one year ago.
    • "The uncertain economic environment in Europe, particularly for consumers, continued to weigh on our portfolio during the quarter," says Chairman & Portfolio Manager Michael Tokarz. "We continue to believe that the long-term fundamentals of our portfolio companies remain bright and we are excited about the optionality that the Equus transaction provides."
    • Previously: MVC Capital reports FQ3 operating income
    • MVC -2%
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • MSON

    Misonix jumps after bullish earnings report

    • Shares of thinly-traded nano cap Misonix (MSON +26.1%) jump on a 17x surge in volume after yesterday's earnings report. Retail investors should think carefully before deploying their hard-earned capital, though. Turnover is only ~120K shares. The average daily turnover is a mere 6.7K shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • E

    Eni CEO placed under investigation for 2011 Nigerian purchase

    • Eni (E -2.3%) says Milan prosecutors have placed Claudio Descalzi, its CEO since May and longtime company veteran, under investigation as part of a preliminary probe related to the acquisition of a Nigerian offshore oil block.
    • Descalzi is suspected by prosecutors of playing a role in the corruption of Nigerian politicians and bureaucrats in the oil license deal which closed in 2011 when he was Eni’s head of exploration and production the deal already is under scrutiny in Nigeria's parliament.
    • Eni has said it did not act illegally in the matter.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • VRA

    Vera Bradley earnings call: New products the focus, not promotions

    • Robert W. Baird upgrades Vera Bradley (NASDAQ:VRA) to Outperform on a call based on a change of direction at the retailer.
    • During yesterday's earnings conference call, management laid out a new strategy to focus on new products instead of promotions. Early response has been good with CEO Robert Wallstrom saying "green shoots" are being seen in the business.
    • Vera Bradley earnings call transcript
    • VRA +1.6% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM
  • NBR

    P-E firm reportedly sells ~8.5% stake in Nabors Industries

    • Nabors Industries (NYSE:NBR) -4.3% premarket on reports that activist investor Pamplona Capital has sold its ~8.5% stake in the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: LULU +15%. JDSU +14%. DGLY +8%. EFOI +11%. FNSR +6%. AIXG +6%. SCOK +5%.
    • Losers: EOPN -28%. SYMX -19%. INVE -18%. CREG -8%. NETE -7%. ASTM -7%. FIVE -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM
  • RSH

    Hold that thought on the RadioShack rally

    • Shares of RadioShack (NYSE:RSH) reverse themselves with a hard skid after posting a 28% post-earnings early rally.
    • RSH -5.5% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM
  • SEAS

    SeaWorld Entertainment sued by a group of investors

    • A group of shareholders have filed suit against SeaWorld Entertainment (NYSE:SEAS) with allegations the company misled investors on the attendance backlash from the Blackfish documentary.
    • SeaWorld disclosed in August with its Q2 report a link between the documentary and guest traffic, a warning the group of shareholders maintain was made too late.
    • SEAS +1.3% premarket to $21 to stay in the relatively tight range it has traded in since the August 13 nosedive.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:21 AM | 3 Comments
  • JLL

    Jones Lang LaSalle with premarket gain after upgrade

    • Expecting Jones Lang LaSalle (NYSE:JLL) to post double-digit earnings growth, JPMorgan upgrades to Overweight from Neutral with price target raised to $143 from $128.
    • Shares +0.6% premarket
    • In it's August 2014 presentation, JLL notes H1 adjusted EPS of $2.07 was up 38%, on fee revenue of $2B, up 16%.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:15 AM
  • TCAP-OLD

    Triangle Capital higher after Wells Fargo upgrade

    • Noting the company's strong credit quality and low cost structure, analyst Jonathan Brock upgrades to Outperform from Market Perform, with price target range boosted to $28.50-$29.50 from $26.50-$28.
    • TCAP-OLD +0.75% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:09 AM
  • CROX

    Crocs clipped by Buckingham Research downgrade

    • Shares of Crocs (NASDAQ:CROX) skid in early trading after Buckingham Research shifts its rating on the company to Neutral from Buy.
    • The investment firm warns that Crocs will see some near-term headwinds which could clip sales and profit.
    • CROX -2.6% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:05 AM
  • DELL

    NY Post: EMC explores selling stake in VMWare

    • EMC +2.7% premarket following a NY Post report that it is exploring a sale of its stake in VMware (NYSE:VMW).
    • Paul Singer’s Elliott Management, which has reported a 2% stake in EMC, has been pressuring the tech giant specializing in cloud-based applications to exit its 80% stake in VMW.
    • EMC bought VMW for $600M in 2004; VMW's current market cap is $41B.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:45 AM
  • OCSL

    Fifth Street Finance boosted by coverage initiation

    • Wunderlich starts FIfth Street Finance (FSC) with a Buy rating and $10.50 price target.
    • Shares +0.4% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 7:32 AM
  • VIAV

    JDS Uniphase +12.4% on plan to split

    • "Combined, the two companies might be valued at $9.85-$14.80 with a midpoint of $12.33," says RBC Capital, upgrading JDS Uniphase (JDSU) to Outperform, with price target lifted to $18 from $11.
    • Previously: JDS Uniphase to split into two public companies
    • JDSU +12.4% premarket to $13.61; other optical networking names, Ciena (NASDAQ:CIEN) +0.8%, Finisar (NASDAQ:FNSR) +1.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:11 AM
  • LULU

    Solid guidance boosts Lululemon, shares +12.2%

    • Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) says it expects full-year revenue to be $1.78B-$1.80B based on a low single-digit comp. The consensus estimate of analysts is $1.78B.
    • The forecast for full-year EPS is $1.72-$1.77 vs. consensus $1.74.
    • Guidance assumes a tax rate of 38.5%.
    • Previous: FQ2 earnings, details
    • LULU +12.2% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:06 AM
  • M

    Sterne Agee puts the brakes on Macy's

    • Sterne Agee downgrades Macy's (NYSE:M) to Neutral from Buy.
    • M -1.9% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 6:47 AM
  • PATAF

    Patagonia Gold trades higher following operational update

    • Patagonia Gold (OTCPK:PATAF) +9% in London following this morning's operational update.
    • Lomada Mine reported record production in August, with a total of 2,961 ounces of gold recovered from the main and trial heap leach pads combined at an all-inclusive cash cost of $625 per ounce.
    • The second large excavator delivered and operational. Lomada is on-track to achieve expansion target of 3,000 ounces of gold per month production by end of Q3.
    • Exploration for 2014 focused on the El Tranquilo block with the identification and development of 22 new and existing targets. Exciting new mineralization discovered at El Calafate and La Canada, near to Flagship deposit, Cap-Oeste. Additional drilling planned for late 2014.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:40 AM
